channel.title: CS 331 — Data Structures
channel.description: How you structure your data changes the questions you can ask about it.

item.title: Vagrant box is ready.
item.description:
The pre-built machine is ready. Here’s what you need to do:

  • Get vagrant and install it on your system.
  • Install virtualbox on your system. It needs permission to run as administrator.
  • Make sure your BIOS (the setup screen you get when you hit F12 during boot) is set to allow virtualization.
  • From the command line, run this command
vagrant box add --name vcs331 http://mccarthy.cs.iit.edu/cs331/static/package.box
mkdir vcs331

vagrant init vcs331
vagrant up
vagrant ssh

You can get a command line by running cmd, or better yet by installing Git and running git-bash.

Once you’ve done this, you will be logged into your new machine! If you need them, the username and password are both vagrant.

To set things up, run the command

setup

It will ask you for your name and email address, and the configure a few things for your machine.

Next you should read the linux account guide to learn more about Linux and Git.

item.title: <sc>Clojure</sc> guide ready.
item.description:
The guide to Clojure is now ready. There are two versions:

  • color
  • black/white

item.title: What's Going On?
item.description:
On the off chance that you are looking at the CS 331 site during the break, you will notice that a bunch of things have changed. Instead of using my custom-written CMS code, I am migrating everything to Jekyll so I can spend more time on content and less on administration.

Looking for the grading script status page? It’s over here.

(defn inc [x]
   (+ x 1))
